q: a frequently parodied Donald Rumsfeld response to a reporter's question about whether there actually was evidence of any link between Hussein" Saddam Hussein and terrorists seeking weapons of mass destruction. The Defense secretary responded: Reports that say that something hasn't happened are always interesting to me because, as we know, there are known knowns; there are things we know we know. We also know there are known unknowns; that is to say we know there are some things we do not know. But there are also unknown unknowns- the ones we don't know we don't know. It is, of course, a logical fallacy to multiply categories beyond necessity, but it's one Donald Rumsfeld has rhetorically mastered to create a self-conscious reputation as a fearless questioner of received truths, one he

Andy Coulson denies being aware of any wrongdoing at the paper, part of Rupert Murdoch 's News Corp media group, and police said last month there was not enough evidence to charge him with any crime. Obviously when he was editor of the News of the World, bad things happened at that newspaper and when he found about those, he resigned. That was the right thing to do, David Cameron told BBC Radio 4's Today program. "I gave him a second chance," David Cameron added. "I think he has done a good job for the government and for the country.

Meanwhile, the Larry King of Pop's brother Randy, took to Twitter when he caught wind of the rumored interview. He tweeted: I can never forget when she had the show on pedophilia during the jury deliberation process in my brother's Santa Maria case. That was no coincidence. He added, "I know that he would not have wanted this," referring to his brother David Letterman . "In fact, she is the last person on earth he would want around his children."
